paper.title: Depth computations from polyhedral images
paper.abstract: A method is developed for the computation of depth maps, modulo scale, from one single image of a polyhedral scene. Only affine shape properties of the scene and image are used, hence no metrical information. Results from simple experiments show good performance, both what concerns exactness and robustness. It is also shown how the underlying theory may be used to single out and characterise certain singular situations that may occur in machine interpretation of line drawings.
